job_title: Anonymous Employee in Eatontown, NJ
pros: A great community of colleagues and everyone is working toward shared goals.
cons: Busy agency with lots to do but all so worth it!

job_title: Social Worker in Aberdeen, NJ
pros: Good benefits, ample time off
cons: Lots of paperwork, frequently overwhelmed with job responsibilities, salary

review_title: Supportive work environment and positive morale
job_title: Clinician in Red Bank, NJ
pros: Very client centered, catering to the needs of clients regardless of financial situation. Great benefits and PTO, comparable pay. Flexible work life balance and supportive adminstration/supervisors. I have recommended the agency to all of the other practioners I know looking for new employment.
cons: None that I can think of

job_title: Residential Supervisor in Lincroft, NJ
pros: CPC has always been a staple in the community. Even years after leaving the company for another career I still reach out to them for assistance. Over the last few years I've partnered up with CPC to deliver positive and educational messages to the youth of the community on mental health assistance, drug and addiction education and services available to those in need.
cons: Can't think of any that come to mind.

job_title: Behavioral Health Clinician in Freehold, NJ
pros: good benefits, supervision, coworkers, experience, flexible
cons: pay, a lot of staff turnover

job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Red Bank, NJ
pros: I am in sustained remission from OUD and attended CPC as a client. I am now employed as a clinician. I cannot say enough positive things about CPC. They are highly patient centered, provide lots of supervision and support, have great opportunities for PD, and use evidence based practices.
cons: This is not particular to CPC but this is a challenging profession in light of pandemic and increased impact on MH.

review_title: Truly dedicated to mission, clients and staff
job_title: Billing Supervisor in Eatontown, NJ
pros: Fantastic Medical benefits, generous vacation time, management and co-workers that go above and beyond to help our clients and each other, positive and fun work environment
cons: High client volume so be prepared to work hard, but we also have a culture of helping each other out and creating positive and fun vibes whenever possible.

job_title: Crisis Intervention Specialist in Eatontown, NJ
pros: great benefits and coworkers were amazing
cons:
no work/life balance
way underpaid 
path to quick burnout

job_title: Project Manager in Middletown, NJ
pros: CPC was a wonderful place to work. Great supervision and a supportive work environment. Competitive salaries, opportunities for growth and advancement.
cons: high caseloads at times as with most community mental health centers

review_title: CPC is a great place to work
job_title: Program Manager in Howell, NJ
pros: CPC offers competitive salaries and benefits, opportunities for advancement, is on the cutting edge of mental health services, and is a truly warm and supportive work environment
cons: I can't think of any.

job_title: Behavioral Health Clinician II in Aberdeen, NJ
pros: Great environment to learn and enhance clinical skills; supportive staff and management; employee input is valued
cons: Caseload can be heavy at times

job_title: Crisis Intervention Specialist in Eatontown, NJ
pros: Better pay recently, knowledgeable and supportive supervisors, hours count towards your License (LPC/LCSW), friendly co-workers, flexible hours. Overall a pleasant work environment,
cons: During your probation period you can't really move around or move up for 6 months. Heavy caseload due to being understaffed.

review_title: CPC is a cutting edge behavioral health provider and a great place to work.
job_title: Vice President Quality Assurance in Eatontown, NJ
pros: CPC is a wonderful company to work for. The agency is designated as a Certified Community Behavioral Health Clinic in NJ, which means it provides a full continuum of office and community based services to individuals with mental health and substance use needs. CPC employs 400+ individuals in a variety of clinical and support positions, so there are plenty of employment opportunities and opportunities for advancement. The leadership is supportive and always focused on excellence and improvement. When the COVID19 pandemic began, CPC's focus and first priority was on client and staff safety. CPC offers generous fringe benefits that include health insurance and paid time off. I have been working at CPC for nearly 3 years, and my plan is to work here until I retire.
cons: I have no cons to report.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Neptune, NJ
pros: Great supervision, continuing education options, overall great company morale, excellent compensation
cons: Understaffed at some projects which can lead to a strain but supervisors are supportive to feedback on that

review_title: Fine to start, but not long term
job_title: Case Manager in Middletown, NJ
pros: Learn a lot and health insurance isn't bad
cons: Very poor pay, very poorly managed, not very professional, no growth

job_title: Behavioral Health Clinician II in Freehold, NJ
pros: Great place to work, fun co workers, laid back
cons: Lack of support, overwhelming at times

review_title: My department was understaffed & when anything went wrong, I was blamed.
job_title: Human Resources Administrator in Eatontown, NJ
pros:
Great benefits . Horizon BCBS, Delta Dental, VSP and company provided Life Insurance . 
You can really make a difference .
Great mission and kind employees . 
Great place to work if you are a social worker . 
Provides reimbursement for continuing education . 
Great place to work if you get along with management . 
Most employees cared about and supported each other .
cons:
Lower pay scale than other related positions . 
People are treated differently based on if management likes them or not .
Policies only matter to certain people and when it benefits management . 
While I was there, there was a very high turnover rate . 
No administrative training provided . 
No support from administrative management . 
Profits go back to executives instead of going back into the company or to employees .

job_title: Crisis Intervention Specialist in Eatontown, NJ
pros: Great/friendly team environment and benefits (i.e. time off, health insurance).  Mobile response allows you to make a difference to the lives of children/families and is a very hands-on learning experience. Overall, working at mobile response has been a truly awesome experience that has taught me so much about myself as a clinician and about working in the community. I feel as though I am a much stronger clinician due to having the opportunity of working with knowledgeable and supportive supervisors.  If working in crisis is something that interests you, working for mobile response will prepare you for other settings that you may transition to in the future.
cons: Unfortunately, the salary is not great but there is room for increases based on licensure, etc.

job_title: Case Manager in Neptune City, NJ
pros: I’ve been in the mental health and addiction field for over a decade, and my experience with CPC is unparalleled.  Management always makes themselves available to offer support, advice, and feedback despite their busy schedule. This is by far the most positive and supportive work environment I’ve ever been in. CPC fosters growth and my supervisors have motivated me to further my career since the beginning , and were willing to offer any assistance possible for my licensure process, often going above and beyond. In addition, it makes a huge difference working for a company that actually puts the client first and works as a collaborative effort to meet each clients needs.
cons: There are really no cons

review_title: Great Company- Room For Growth- Good Benefits
job_title: Program Supervisor in Red Bank, NJ
pros: Many programs offer a lot of opportunity for supervision and growth. Benefits are affordable. Very generous PTO. Family like atmosphere- this agency is growing, but it doesn't feel like a big corporation or anything. Multifaceted experience offered- integrated care for mental health and additions, children, adults and families too. Partnering with several outside agencies, the CPC name is well known and respected. Salary is commensurate with your experience.
cons: It might take some time to adjust to the caseload and multitude of state regulations BUT they ask the same of every employee.

job_title: Behavior Therapist in Middletown, NJ
pros: Great support.Good support from peers and management. Good ties to community and local schools. Room for advancement because of company size. Great benefits. Good support from supervisor and director.
cons: Some clientele are difficult. Time off has to be earned in the first six months. Workload is heavy. Necessary to work more than specified time to get work done and perform up to a good standard.

job_title: Case Manager in Eatontown, NJ
pros: Could not be happier working for this agency. I have been employed with CPC for nearly 5 years and have worked in several different programs. I can truly say that I would send my own child to this organization for services if ever necessary. The selflessness, professionalism, and determination exhibited by all my co-workers is inspiring. The overall family atmosphere that is fostered in this agency makes coming into work a pleasure! I am so proud to be a part of this organization and the enormous impact they have on the community!
cons: Nothing that I can see

job_title: Behavioral Health Clinician in Aberdeen, NJ
pros: Great supervision and management helps to teach you skills to advance your career.  Able to move around the agency and take promotions.  Good co-workers and positive culture.
cons: Large caseload and a lot of paperwork but the company takes all clients so it is too be expected.

job_title: Program Manager in Red Bank, NJ
pros: The agency is committed to reaching the needs of the people it serves. From the administration down to the line staff, employees are dedicated to implementing best practices, navigating the political and social needs of the community, and providing preventative and assertive care. The agency is supportive of their employees and provide opportunities towards educational and professional growth.
cons: High volume of tasks, time and task management skills are important.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Red Bank, NJ
pros: Leadership to field staff committed to the clients. All levels of care provided, except inpatient, at multiple locations across the county and treatment for mental health, addictions, and co-occurring disorders. Therapeutic school a hidden gem. Ample room to grow within the organization. Very much a team environment. Expanding services and many new opportunities at all levels.
cons: Support staff could be nicer Red Bank/Middletown location

job_title: Special Education Teacher in Morganville, NJ
pros: Small ratio better student and teacher. Teachers are provided with resources to maximize opportunities to reward student behavior. Opportunity to write curriculum
cons: Teaching is not a priority. Clinical care if students trumps instruction. To much time spent :/ a academic block. Special elective teachers are insufficient to provide adequate opportunity.

review_title: Great sense of community, not so great pay.
job_title: Social Worker in Red Bank, NJ
pros: This is the perfect job for a new social worker.  Tons of growth opportunities and this job will prepare you for he next step in your social work career.
cons: This company as well as many other behavioral health companies does not pay their social workers or therapists very well.

review_title: A place where I can make a difference
